analysis.key_quote: Schedule F doesn’t improve employee performance-it only increases the likelihood of corruption by allowing the party in power to install individuals who are beholding to the party or its leader and not the constitution.
analysis.rationale: The comment opposes Schedule F by emphasizing the risks of politicization and corruption, highlighting concerns about accountability to political parties rather than to constitutional duties, which aligns with a defense of merit-based systems and employee rights.
